meanings.definition: A high, rocky hill or peak
meanings.sent1: The hikers climbed the tor to enjoy the view from the top.
meanings.sent2: The tor stood majestically against the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The tor seemed to challenge anyone daring to conquer its height.
meanings.sent4: The tor loomed over the landscape like a giant guardian.
meanings.sent5: The tor's rugged beauty captivated all who beheld it.

meanings.sent1: She had to tor the lid of the jar to open it.
meanings.sent2: He torqued the screwdriver to tighten the loose screw.
meanings.sent3: The dancer torqued her body in a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds torqued the branches of the tree in a storm.
meanings.sent5: He torqued the rope tightly to secure the boat to the dock.

meanings.definition: A tower or turret, especially on a ship
meanings.sent1: The sailors climbed to the tor to keep watch over the sea.
meanings.sent2: The tor on the ship provided a strategic vantage point.
meanings.sent3: The tor on the ship looked like a tiny castle floating on water.
meanings.sent4: The tor on the ship gleamed in the sunlight, guiding their way.
meanings.sent5: The tor on the ship swayed gently with the motion of the waves.
